title: Can we get a "Lesser Sightstone"?
body:
Currently, one of the reasons not many people play support is that you have to take the role of a mage or tank on a really low income. Thus, you need a support item. Problem is deciding between upgrading the support item early so you can actually get money or buying an early Sightstone so you don't miss out on vision. Either one winds up with less of the other, you get less gold or you get less vision.

So I thought "What if the sightstone didn't build out of a Ruby Crystal and instead built out of a lesser sightstone?" With a much cheaper sightstone that only holds 1 or 2 charges, the support can finish upgrading their income item so they aren't way behind and still be able to ward. Later, they can finish the sightstone and be able to ward to the extent a support needs to.

I'm always building the "Eyes" as a support (Eye of the Equinox, Eye of the Oasis, Eye of the Watchers) so I can actually get the rest of my build, and as a result, I'm missing out on actives that really help and the item active cdr passive from Ruby Sightstone.

Let me know what your thoughts are.

replies.body: Personally I'm not sure why they don't get rid of sightstone and give some support items interaction with the trinkets to increase recharge rate or max # charges.  You can tack it onto the gold income items if needed.  Idk I never liked spending 800g for 150hp and 3 wards.  I don't mind one of my primary roles is to help make sure vision is up.  However, especially at low ELO, I find myself going through Sightstone after Sightstone of charges and constantly backing (so I am losing XP a lot) because no one else will light up the map with me.

Encourage your jungler to play Jax or Lee Sin, I guess. They'll at least be ward hopping a lot.

I don't know.

That is true as well.  It was an idea.  Not SPECIFICALLY the charges thing.  However, I was just trying to come up with an idea to help against one thing that I've never felt good about as a support (I'm a support main anyway).  Being behind in levels and gold can be frustrating, but to start the game, sinking 800g into a Sightstone never 'feels' good.  Which is partly why Support is stuck with it since if it felt good other roles would get it way more often, so the role who doesn't get money should just get it.  I'll admit that Vision and who does it is a hard problem.  Especially since Sightstone exists now and will probably continue to exist due to the playerbase rioting (heheheh..... bad joke) if they took it from us.  Vision is kind of locked in place with Sightstone.

I understand the power of it and that's why I do it.  I'm not sure how they could modify the red trinket (or if another role could just pick it up instead) to make Sightstone more replaceable.   Who knows.  It looks like they're experimenting with other avenues of vision denial (I know {{item:3147}} is a situational thing and not always bought) so hopefully they'll look into making Sightstone feel more exciting to buy and less like paying your taxes. :)

I'm a Mid main, but whenever I've played Support getting a Sightstone first back has always felt comparable to getting a Needlessly Large Rod first back when Mid. While the Rod gives damage to let me harass my enemies more, Sightstone enables me to have longer lasting on-demand wards and remove my enemies wards. It feels powerful and smart to me, even if that's all it does. 

Maybe it's because I'm use to being in a lane with 7 ways the enemy jungler can approach me and I can't light them all up that it feels so good to be able to use the Sightstone to light up bot lane early.
And then once you're bot, there's only 2-3 ways to be ganked, all of which are warded up because of the sightstone and you feel safe.
Personally I prefer that the jungler/top laner/ADC get sweeper. Supports usually have near 0% bonus attack speed. Why give the clearing power to the person who takes the longest to do it?
ADC should definitely take blue trinket, imo.

Supports usually have the highest movement speed, so they can scan the largest area of the map.

Also, if allies are near, they can assist in the ward kill, meaning that the person with the sweeper doesn't have to be the one with the high attack speed.
Easy solution - one or more of the trinket modifiers gives you a shorter version of sweeper whenever you place a ward.

Why are supports still the cornerstone of vision? A Sona should never be alone because of how squishy she is, but as support Sona is still expected to be responsible for keeping vision on hard to control areas. Specific champ archetypes having having specific jobs in the vision wars makes more sense than your position determining it. Riot needs to eliminate signtstone altogether and just tune trinkets/wards so that everyone can contribute well to vision.

thats like saying, lets just eliminate half the set up and work of the game

everyone does contribute for vision but the support is the lowest gold income and therefore is their job to light up the map most of the time

Wards are no longer really tied to gold income though, and with the ward limit the support can't contribute enough to cover for everyone anyways. I'm not saying that we should eliminate the vision game at all, just why is so much of the responsibility still on supports? Why is the position that usually consists of either enchanters or peelers with no mobility the one that's expected to keep global vision? Make vision truely a team game and let supports support by buffing, debuffing, and peeling.

This would be the first step towards making the support role more desirable and fixing the queue problems we have too.
